creator: Paul_B007@hotmail.com
text:
When entering a command line to convert xml to pdf eg :-

java org.apache.fop.apps.Fop -xml "C:\test.xml" -xsl "C:\test.xsl" -
pdf "C:\test.pdf"

the command does not work when the command line is greater than 125 characters. 
No error is returned and the command just seems to be ignored. It works fine is 
the command length is 125 or less.

Paul

I'm running Windows XP and my command works. The command/arguments portion
(after the prompt "C:\Program Files\Java\fop-0.20.4>") is 152 characters long:

C:\Program Files\Java\fop-0.20.4>fop -d -xml
C:\xml_med7\biglinux\test_MIWC_1.2.XML -xsl C:\xml_med7\fo\xml_med7_MIWC_pdf.fo
-pdf test_MIWC_1.2_pdf.pdf

It would be useful to see your error output.
creator: the.webmaestro@gmail.com
Paul_B007@hotmail.com
text:
I am actually running Windows 2000 not XP . I accidentally clicked the wrong 
one.

Here is an example that does not work. There is no error output after running 
this command. It just goes back to a command prompt.

java org.apache.fop.apps.Fop -d -xml "C:\ArseyTarseyFarseyWarseyHarsey.xml" -
xsl "C:\stylesheets\porder.xsl" -pdf "C:\arse.pdf"

No output whatsoveter?  I'm at a Windows 2000 server and do get output when I 
put in that command string.  Admittedly, the output is complaints at the 
console, but it's still output.

On top of that, invoking fop.bat seems to produce a huge command line call 
(much larger than the one provided here) and, again...I get command line 
complaints about not having the XML and XSL files, but I do get something.
creator: raultman@fcci-group.com

text:
Out of curiosity, have to tried this with other Java programs that take command 
line arguments?  What JVM are you running (manufacturer and version number)?  
If there's really no response at all, it suggests to me that the problem might 
be outside of the FOP code...ie a bug in the JVM or even a problem with your 
Win2k command interpreter.
creator: raultman@fcci-group.com

text:
This is a restriction of the command line processor. Use cmd.exe instead
of command.com.
creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
